subject: Re: Unicode proposal, yet again.
msgSnippet: If I may weigh in, I know its rather a large thing to bring up but my only concern is that we may want rethink our coverage of Senior QuickScript in the
messageBody:
If I may weigh in, I know its rather a large thing to bring up but my
only concern is that we may want rethink our coverage of Senior
QuickScript in the Unicode proposal. I say this with immense
reluctance since Senior is my particular joy but I have several
reasons never the less:

1. The set of glyphs included in the current Unicode proposal omits a
large number critical variations necessary for Senior QS (one example:
the way "Roe" attaches to following "Ice". Another example: the "Roe"
+ "Zoo" which is found in rendering Mrs. ). Being limited to this
reduced Senior QS set results in writing that is neither Senior nor
Junior but an undocumented and inconsistent hybrid which I suggest we
do not wish to permanently embed in the Unicode standard.

2. From what I have read, Junior was intended to be used for
typographic purposes and Senior was not. Although this decision was no
doubt made in an era of typewriters and manual typesetting, even now
the TrueType font rendering specification (anchors and scripts et al),
are inadequate to properly render Senior.

In my humble opinion, I suggest removing those glyphs which try to
support Senior QS and proceed with a purely Junior QS set of glyphs
until the considerable Senior QS requirements are full described.
Personally I would desperately like to see Senior QS in the Unicode
standard and would love to contribute as much as I can to such a
proposal if you think it appropriate. Indeed, I have made fair headway
in locating the needs for Senior QS and I would enthusiastically post
what I have found if you believe it will be of use but I can not claim
it is complete yet.
